sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action creates a folder on the Box account of the associated credentials.

Inputs:

  • Name - Name of the folder to be created.
  • Parent Folder ID - ID of the folder under which the new folder will be created. If a value is not provided then the folder will be created at the top level.
  • As User - As-User can be used by admins, co-admins to impersonate another user while executing an API request. ID of the user with which the folder needs to be created.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".
  • Folder ID - ID of the created folder. Will be populated in case of success.
  • Folder Info - Information of the created folder in JSON format. Will be populated in case of success.
  • Folder - Information of the created folder.
    • ID
    • Type
    • Name
    • Description
    • E Tag
    • Item Status
    • Size
    • Shared Link

Error Messages:

  • Item with the same name already exists.
  • Names cannot contain non-printable ASCII, / or \, leading or trailing whitespace. The special names "." or ".." are also unsupported.
  • Parent folder with given ID not found or associated credentials do not have permissions to access the folder.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.
  • User ID provided in Create Folder As User input not found.

Additional Notes:

  • To enable 'As-User' functionality for Box applications using OAuth2 with JWT, please navigate to the Advanced Features section in the developer console and enable the "Perform actions on behalf of users" permission.

To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action creates a folder on the Box account of the associated credentials.

Inputs:

  • Name - Name of the folder to be created.
  • Parent Folder ID - ID of the folder under which the new folder will be created. If a value is not provided then the folder will be created at the top level.
  • As User - As-User can be used by admins, co-admins to impersonate another user while executing an API request. ID of the user with which the folder needs to be created.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".
  • Folder ID - ID of the created folder. Will be populated in case of success.
  • Folder Info - Information of the created folder in JSON format. Will be populated in case of success.

Error Messages:

  • Item with the same name already exists.
  • Names cannot contain non-printable ASCII, / or \, leading or trailing whitespace. The special names "." or ".." are also unsupported.
  • Parent folder with given ID not found or associated credentials do not have permissions to access the folder.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.
  • User ID provided in Create Folder As User input not found.

Additional Notes:

  • To enable 'As-User' functionality for Box applications using OAuth2 with JWT, please navigate to the Advanced Features section in the developer console and enable the "Perform actions on behalf of users" permission.

To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.name: Create Folder
